availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Parker (Maysville (Mason County) hotel keeper)

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, jailer. Kentucky native. Married Mary Parker. Hotel keeper in Maysville in 1850. Owned seven enslaved people in Maysville in 1850. Jailer in Maysville in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, City of Maysville in District 1, p. 75; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, City of Maysville in District 1; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, 2nd Ward Maysville, p. 33.
